00005 //                      ****NOTE****
00006 //Change XPLEECONFIGVERSION if updating any of the values below
00007 #define ZONECOUNT 24                    /// The number of zones that are included in the system
00008 #define AREACOUNT 8                     /// The number of areas that are included in the system
00009 #define USERNAMELENGTH 10               /// Descriptive name of the user, visable in xPL messages
00010 #define USERPASSLENGTH 40               /// Maximum lenght of password system wide
00011 #define USERCOUNT 5                             /// maximum number of users in the system, first user is always the admin login
00012 #define DEVICEDESCLENGTH 10             /// Maximum number of characters in the Zone and Area description text
00013 #define XPLEECONFIGVERSION 0x60u /// First character of the EEProm config, used to ensure data is valid and we are not reading an old config after system update
00014 
00015 // \todo XPLBUFFERSIZE fails at 5, why?
00016 #define XPLBUFFERSIZE 2                 ///< the number of xPL messages that can be buffered for transmit
00017 
00018 // EOL
00019 #define EOLNORMAL 960           /// Value of the normal state
00020 #define EOLTRIGGER 1024         /// Value of the triggered state
00021 #define EOLTOLERANCE 50         /// Tolerance factor, ie not triggered = EOLNORMAL +/- EOLTOLERANCE. Anything outside of normal or triggered is a tamper result
00022 
00023 // EE Memory Map
00024 /*
00025  #define EEDATASIZE_USER (int)USERCOUNT * (int)(USERNAMELENGTH + USERPASSLENGTH)
00026  #define EEDATASIZE_DEVICEDESC (int)DEVICEDESCLENGTH * (int)(ZONECOUNT + AREACOUNT)
00027  #define EEDATASTART_CONFIG 0x0000 // EE memory start position for config data (size 51)
00028  #define EEDATASTART_XPL  sizeof(AppConfig) + 2 //0x0035 // EE memory start position for config data (size 31)
00029  #define EEDATASTART_ZONE EEDATASTART_XPL + sizeof(xPLConfig) + 2 //0x0056 // EE memory start position for config data (size 80)
00030  #define EEDATASTART_AREA EEDATASTART_ZONE + sizeof(ZoneConfig) + 2//0x00A8 // EE memory start position for config data(size 40)
00031  #define EEDATASTART_USER (EEDATASTART_AREA + sizeof(AreaConfig) + 2) // 220   //was 0x00D2  (size 50*5=250)
00032  #define EEDATASTART_DEVICEDESC ((int)EEDATASTART_USER + (int)EEDATASIZE_USER + 2)  // EE data start position for Device Description text (size 10*(8+20)=280)
00033  #define EEDATASTART_MPFS ((int)EEDATASTART_DEVICEDESC + (int)EEDATASIZE_DEVICEDESC + 2)
00034  */
00035 
00036 #define EEDATASIZE_USER 250
00037 #define EEDATASIZE_DEVICEDESC 320
00038 
00039 #define EEDATASTART_CONFIG 0
00040 #define EEDATASTART_XPL  53
00041 #define EEDATASTART_ZONE 282
00042 #define EEDATASTART_AREA 379
00043 #define EEDATASTART_USER 395
00044 #define EEDATASTART_DEVICEDESC 645
00045 #define EEDATASTART_MPFS 964

00047 // HTTP2 server authentication
00048 #define HTTP_AUTH_ADMIN     (0x00)      /// Access level granted to admin user
00049 #define HTTP_AUTH_OTHER     (0x01)      /// Access to all other pages
00050 
00051 // Battery conditions
00052 #define BATTERY_DISCONNECTED 6          /// Below this voltage the battery is determined as disconnected
00053 #define BATTERY_LOW 12                          /// Below this voltage the battery needs charging
00054 
00055 
00056 #define GATEWAYCHANGEDDELAY 20          /// Number of seconds delay before sending gateway changed message. Prevents issues with clients flooding network with updates
00057 #define SMTPSMSIZE 4                            /// Number of tasks that can be queued in the SMTP state machine
00058 
00059 #define SMTP_TEST_WAITING (0x8002u)     /// this result means we are still waiting for a response
00060 #define SMTP_TEST_DONE (0x8003u)        /// this result means there is no test under way
00061 
00062 #define NTP_TEST_DONE 0                         /// Network Time Procotol response
00063 #define NTP_TEST_PROGRESS 1                     /// Network Time Procotol response
00064 #define NTP_TEST_COMPLETED 2            /// Network Time Procotol response
00065 #define NTP_TEST_DNSERROR 3                     /// Network Time Procotol response
00066 #define NTP_TEST_ARPERROR 4                     /// Network Time Procotol response
00067 #define NTP_TEST_TIMEOUT 5                      /// Network Time Procotol response

00069 //******************************************************************************
00070 /** Check the TCP/IP stack is configured ************************************/
00071 //******************************************************************************
00072 #if !defined(STACK_USE_SMTP_CLIENT)
00073     #error Security requires SMTP client
00074 #endif 
00075 
00076 #if !defined(STACK_USE_DNS)
00077     #error Security  needs DNS for resolving SMTP Server names
00078 #endif 
00079 
00080 #if !defined(EEPROM_CS_TRIS) && !defined(SPIFLASH_CS_TRIS)
00081     #error Security requires some where to save its config data to.
00082 #endif 
00083 
00084 #if !defined(STACK_USE_HTTP2_SERVER)
00085     #error Security would love to use the web server
00086 #endif 
00087 
00088 #if !defined(STACK_CLIENT_MODE)
00089     #error Security says stack client have, you must

00104 } BatteryStates;

00152 /// When checking the zone state in EOL, these are the possible results
00153 typedef enum _Zone_States {
00154         StateNothing = 0,               ///< Nothing has changed since the last check
00155         StateNormal,                    ///< Since last check the zone has changed to normal
00156         StateTrigger,                   ///< Since last check the zone has changes to Triggered
00157         StateTamper,                    ///< Since last check the zone has changes to Tampered
00158         StateBypass,                    ///< In bypassed state
00159         StateIsolate,                   ///< In Isolated state
00160         StateAlarm
00161 } Zone_States;
00162 
00163 
00164 /// Stores all of the configuration for ech of the zones
00165 typedef struct {
00166         unsigned int IsTriggered:1;                     ///< If the zone in a triggered state
00167         unsigned int IsNO:1;                            ///< Is the zone Normally Open (fales = Normally Closed)
00168         unsigned int IsEntry:1;                         ///< Is this zone an entry and exit point
00169         unsigned int IsIsolated:1;                      ///< Is zone isolated
00170         unsigned int IsBypassed:1;                      ///< Is zone Bypassed
00171         unsigned int IsArmed:1;                         ///< Is Zone Armed
00172         unsigned int IsAlarmed:1;                       ///< Did the zone cause the alarm to go off
00173         unsigned int IsChangeFlagged:1;         ///< Used for state changes
00174         unsigned int IsTampered:1;                      ///< Is the zone in a tampered state
00175         Zone_States State;                                      ///< Current state of the zone
00176         ZoneTypes ZoneType:3;                           ///< xPL Type of zone (perimeter, interior or 24 hour)
00177         AlarmTypes ZoneAlarmType:4;                     ///< xPL Alarm type (eg fire, flood, gas etc)
00178         unsigned short int AreaList:AREACOUNT;          ///< Bit field list of the areas that this zone is a member of
00179         unsigned int BounceDelay:8;                     ///< Timer for reducing impact of a bouncing IO lines
00180 } ZoneConfigs;
00181 extern ZoneConfigs ZoneConfig[ZONECOUNT];
00182 
00183 
00184 /// Stores each Area configuration information
00185 typedef struct {
00186         unsigned int IsTriggered:1;                     ///< Is the Area triggered
00187         unsigned int IsIsolated:1;                      ///< Is area isolated
00188         unsigned int IsBypassed:1;                      ///< Is area Bypassed
00189         unsigned int IsArmed:1;                         ///< Is area Armed
00190         unsigned int IsAlarmed:1;                       ///< Did a zone in this area cause the alarm to go off
00191         unsigned int IsChangeFlagged:1;         ///< Used for state changes
00192         unsigned int IsTampered:1;                      ///< Has a zone in this area been tampered
00193         Zone_States State;                                      ///< The current state of the area
00194         AlarmTypes ZoneAlarmType:4;                     ///< xPL Alarm type (eg fire, flood, gas etc)
00195 } AreaConfigs;
00196 
00197 extern AreaConfigs AreaConfig[AREACOUNT];

00200 /// General system Configuration entries
00201 typedef struct {
00202         unsigned int xPL_Heartbeat_Interval;    ///< Interval of the xPL heatbeat message in seconds
00203         char xPL_My_Instance_ID[18];                    ///< xPL instance name of this device
00204         short int ExitDelay;                                    ///< Number of seconds you have to exit from an entry/exit zone
00205         short int EntryDelay;                                   ///< Number of seconds you have to disarm alarm from an entry/exit zone before alarm goes off
00206         short int AlarmingDuration;                             ///< Number of seconds that the alarm will ring for
00207         short int Alarming24Duration;                   ///< Number of seconds that the alarm will ring for a 24 hour alarm type
00208         short int SirenDelay24h;                                ///< Number of seconds before the external siren is activated for 24h alarm type
00209         short int SirenDelay;                                   ///< Number of seconds before the external siren is activated
00210         char SMTP_To[80];                                               ///< Email address to send messages to
00211         char SMTP_Server[20];                                   ///< POP3 server
00212         char SMTP_User[40];                                             ///< POP3 User name
00213         char SMTP_Password[20];                                 ///< POP3 Password
00214         int SMTP_Port;                                                  ///< Port number
00215         unsigned int Use_AES:1;                                 ///< Use AES encryption on the user feild in the xPL message
00216         //unsigned int SMTP_UseSSL:1;                   // Use SSL for sending email. Removed due to application size issues (sigh)
00217         unsigned int SMTP_Active:1;                             ///< Disable emails
00218         unsigned int SMTP_OnlyInitalAlarm:1;    ///< Only send emails on the inital alarm
00219         unsigned int SMTP_ArmDisarm:1;                  ///< Send emails on all arm and disarm events
00220         char NTP_Server[35];                                    ///< NTP Server name
00221 } xPLConfigs;

00260 /// Defines a task in the xPL messages to be transmitted task buffer
00261 typedef struct {
00262         TaskBuffers TaskBuffered;                               ///< Type of task
00263         rom char * ErrorMessage;                                ///< Error message passed to SendError
00264         unsigned int FlaggedZones[ZONECOUNT];   ///< An array of the Zones that have been flagged for this message
00265         unsigned int FlaggedAreas[AREACOUNT];   ///< An array of the Areas that have been flagged for this message
00266         Zone_States NewZoneState;                               ///< Used by SendAreaStateMsg to know what changes have been made                       
00267         int TaskState;                                                  ///< 0 means completed, > 0 means more things to do. Value > 0 can be used by task to track state
00268 } xPLTasks;
00269 
00270 
00271 /// Task buffer for sending xPL messages
00272 typedef struct {
00273         unsigned int CurentTask;                                ///< End up being the last task that was processed
00274         unsigned int FreePosition;                              ///< Task number that is free to create a new task in
00275         int PositionCounter;                                    ///< Keeps track of what position we were in so it can return back to the next spot. Ie cycle through all zone and send multiple messages (SendAreaStateMsg)
00276         TICK GatewayChangedTimer;                               ///< Provides a delay in sending the xPL gateway changed message
00277         xPLTasks Task[XPLBUFFERSIZE];                   ///< an array of the tasks, see SMTPTaskStack
00278 } xPLTaskLists;
00279 
00280 /// The Task buffer for sending xPL messages
00281 extern xPLTaskLists xPLTaskList;

00291         SMTP_Reset,
00292         SMTP_InternetRestored
00293 } SMTP_SendTypes;

00295 /// State of the email stack
00296 typedef enum _SMTP_States {
00297         SMTP_SM_InQ =0,
00298         SMTP_SM_Working,
00299         SMTP_SM_Done
00300 } SMTP_States;
00301 
00302 /// Task buffer for queuing up emails to be sent
00303 typedef struct {
00304         SMTP_SendTypes SMTP_SendType;           ///< Type of email to be sent
00305         SMTP_States SMTP_State;                         ///< Current state of the task (State Machine)
00306 } SMTPTaskStack;
00307 
00308 /// Overall Task buffer, mostly accessed to create a new tasks
00309 typedef struct {
00310         unsigned int CurentTask;                        ///< Task number being processed by the stack at the moment
00311         unsigned int FreePosition;                      ///< Task number that is free to create a new task in
00312         SMTPTaskStack Task[SMTPSMSIZE];         ///< an array of the tasks, see SMTPTaskStack
00313 } SMTPTaskLists;
00314 
00315 extern SMTPTaskLists SMTPTaskList;
00316 extern int SMPTTestResult;                              ///< used for testing email

00319 /// state machine for NTP process, see SNTP Customised.c
00320 typedef enum {
00321         SM_HOME = 0,
00322         SM_NAME_RESOLVE,
00323         SM_ARP_START_RESOLVE,
00324         SM_ARP_RESOLVE,
00325         SM_ARP_START_RESOLVE2,

00330         SM_UDP_SEND,

00332         SM_SHORT_WAIT,
00333         SM_WAIT
00334 } SNTPStates;
